AITA for not giving into Nick's older roommate's demands about his girlfriend? For context, Nick is a 23 year old living in a subletted room of an apartment of a 43 year old professor. No contract, Nick just gives her money each month. When Nick moved in, he told her that his girlfriend stays overnight twice a week. She said no problem to this. His girlfriend and Nick are both very quiet and friendly, and they mostly keep to themselves by watching TV in Nick's room. His girlfriend has been spending more time during the day on Saturdays (like she'll be in Nick's room Saturday afternoon - Sunday afternoon), but she's actually only stayed overnight once a week since Nick has lived there. They try to invite Nick's roommate to go places whenever they go out, but she always says no. When Nick first met his roommate his girlfriend did nOT spend this much time at Nick's old apartment, but since Nick moved closer to her they now can spend more time together. So Nick's life has just slightly changed since moving to this apartment; Nick promises he didn't intentionally omit how much she spends in the apartment. Total, she's probably IN Nick's ROOM with the door closed for 20 hours a week including sleeping.

Nick's roommate also didn't tell him that there's a chore list of about 50 things that needs to get done every week. No problem, Nick is happy to do it if it'll make her happy and make the apartment look nice. Nick has also driven dinner over to her office when she's been stressed about work. Nick has tried to be nice.

They're both super busy so his girlfriend comes over once during the weekday from 8:30 - 10:30, and then she comes over to Nick's room on Saturday afternoon around 2; they'll go get some food for a few hours because it stresses Nick's roommate that his girlfriend is in Nick's room. Then they'll come back and watch TV for the rest of the night in Nick's room. GF's then there until Sunday around 3 PM. For context, they are now in Nick's room the ENTIRE time with the door closed and the TV on low, but they used to occasionally do homework in the living room or eat in the kitchen. At first, she didn't like them eating in the kitchen or being in the living room (common spaces) when she got home which Nick totally understood, so she asked them to eat in Nick's room and not cook in the kitchen so no big deal; they now order out and eat in Nick's room. Also, his girlfriend has never showered there; she showers before at her home so she doesn't have to use their water/shower while she's there.

Roommate has confessed that she often can't tell if they are in Nick's room or not unless his gf's car is out on the street because they are quiet. Fast forward, Nick's roommate's work has gotten really stressful and she now tells him that it bothers her that his girlfriend is in Nick's room on Saturday because she "can't focus with more than one person in the apartment" and she asked that his girlfriend leaves by 12 PM. She also asked that Nick tell her his schedule of when she is and isn't in the apartment. Nick now gives her 24 hours notice and tries to tell her their schedule. Nick is a little annoyed at this point because he is trying to be accommodating, but whatever. They normally leave at like 2 PM now to go to the library on Sundays because Nick is not gonna have a curfew imposed on him at 23, but he is doing his best.

Now the kicker. What really hurt was that one of Nick's students (Nick teaches 2nd grade in a bad neighborhood) was shot and killed instantly on a Friday. Nick texted his roommate that his gf and he would be in his room all day Saturday because Nick was mourning and crying and grieving because you know, Nick's kid was a victim of gun violence. She says she's sorry and blah blah blah, she's nice. THEN Sunday at around 2 PM, Nick managed to leave the apartment and an hour later (3 PM) while they were out, Nick got this text message.

"if possible I’d prefer that you and gf not spend more time here together today. I’m not feeling well and it stresses me out when you guys are here on the weekends, especially since lately it seems to be the whole weekend and not just overnight. I understand you wanted more time yesterday but you did not ask for today and I’ve already asked before that you and Koryne not stay past noon on Sundays. This is my home and I need to have a space in which I feel comfortable."

When Nick saw that text, he just broke down crying. It definitely was not the whole weekend? Nick was heartbroken that someone could be so unforgiving when she knew Nick was upset about his kid dying.

It's not just her home; Nick also pays rent there. Nick doesn't know. AMTA? Nick was tearing up while re-reading that text. Nick is moving out at the end of December which he is very thankful for; he is just nervous for these next few weeks. Nick's job is really hard sometimes ( re: Nick's student died) and his girlfriend is Nick's rock through it all. Nick can't do this without her. Also Nick keeps saying in his room because whether or not his girlfriend is there, Nick is in his room with the door closed. So it doesn't really affect the roommate in anyway.

TL;DR Roomate was ok with gf staying over twice a week, she's actually not. She gave Nick a list of 50 things to clean every week and Nick does them. She didn't like them in common spaces so they don't hang out there anymore. She told Nick to give her his schedule so she knows when they'll be in the apartment and Nick has done that. Nick has tried to be accommodating to his roommate about his girlfriend, and roommate was ok with his girlfriend until her work got stressful. She sent a really cold heartless text to Nick about his girlfriend being in his room 2 days after one of Nick's 7-year-old students was shot. AITA?

AITA for not wanting to deal with Nick's best friend’s chaotic life anymore? Nick [F26] has been friends with this person [F25] since they were 13. She is a great friend in terms of being there to listen. Her family and her have always been poor. Her mother has never been a good role model - keeping publicly abusive relationships, drinking constantly and not being there for her daughter. Her family life over all has always been hard. She has dealt with depression and anxiety her whole life.

Nick's friend has never been able to keep a job more than a couple months since high school. She just quits randomly. Nick had paid thousands of dollars for her over the years in the form of rent, food and entertainment so that she can enjoy nights out with their friend group.

She has two children who she sees every other week because her and the dad are separated. When she doesn’t have the kids, she goes on drinking benders. During these, she will start shit with her family members and boyfriends causing huge fights. She just got a DUI a couple months ago and is now on probation but is refusing to stop drinking or doing drugs.

She has wanted to kill herself for years, and has acted on it tens of times. She will blow up everyone’s phones saying she is taking a bottle of pills and then not answer anyone’s calls. This causes her loved ones to leave responsibilities like work, racing around town while in tears trying to find her and getting the cops involved. Last episode she had called Nick for the first time saying she was going to kill herself which sent Nick into a panic and Nick had to go track her down thinking Nick's friend would be dead by the time Nick got there. Every time is has turned out she didn’t actually take pills and she was saying/doing crazy shit cause she had been drinking. Nick has stopped inviting her out with new people because she will show up wasted and embarrass Nick.

Nick was already distancing herself a bit because Nick couldn’t emotionally deal with the chaos, but the last straw was when Nick foolishly let her borrow a few hundred dollars. She had a new job and seemed to be doing well, so Nick told her yes but Nick needed it back in two weeks. She promised Nick she’d have the money back to Nick “100%”. She said she needed help because her kids’ dad fucked her over on daycare. Turns out she quit that job the day prior (after 1 week of being there) and that she actually needed that money for rent. She told Nick all of this a week later and genuinely didn’t seem to realize that her story was much different than what she told Nick before. That deadline is now three months ago. She has brought up paying Nick back once. She got another job a couple weeks ago and Nick heard from a friend she already quit it.

She’s had a history of dating physically and mentally abusive men. Yesterday Nick got a call from her mom asking if Nick’d seen her because she hadn’t come home. Nick said no and automatically knew what this was about. The night prior she had texted Nick bragging how she cheated on her boyfriend. This boyfriend has blatantly said to their group of friends that he’s not afraid to beat a woman. Nick knew he was evil. Turns out her sister told him that she had cheated on him, he drove to her house, broke in, smashed her phone and beat her. She now has bruises all over her and is (hopefully) getting a restraining order. Nick was not surprised at all, Nick had told Nick's friend he’d beat her one day and Nick's friend (who is also one of her bfs) didn’t believe Nick. He is an overly-obvious abusive person. Yelling at her constantly in front of strangers, acting crazy all of the time.

In summary, Nick is caught up because Nick has suffered from crippling anxiety and depression but it’s never brought this type of destruction onto everyone around Nick or Nick. It seems at this point she’s choosing all of these awful things to happen to her at this point. (Besides being beat obviously). Blatantly self-sabotaging. Which Nick knows can be from mental illness. Where do you draw the line blaming it on mental illness? Nick doesn’t want to be dragged into this anymore. Nick cares about her and her wellbeing but it’s been 10 years of this chaos.

Something happens every week. And every week either she or her mom will call Nick to talk about it, thinking that Nick needs to be informed of what happened. The same shit that always happens. Nothing ever changes, and in fact gets worse every year. It brings a lot of stress onto to Nick and has ruined a lot of days for Nick, crying, leaving social setting to go make sure she’s okay or sitting around in anxiety over how she’s doing.

Am I the asshole for wanting to stay friends but not wanting to hear or be dragged into her mess?

AITA for telling Nick's boyfriend off? | Nick (20f) is a stay at home parent to Nick and her boyfriend's (24m) 4 mo old baby. Her boyfriend works over night & sleeps up until an hour before he has to go work again, so of course Nick is responsible for their daughter 90% of the time.

He just got back to work as he spent the entire year that Nick was pregnant unemployed just because. He is qualified and can easily get a job but he chose not to. He was able to do this because a few years ago Nick was in a bad car wreck and received a decent amount of settlement money for Nick's injuries. The whole time up until now, Nick and her boyfriend have been paying the rent with Nick's savings. Even now that he works he hasn’t contributed to rent, the only thing he pays for is when Nick and her boyfriend go out to eat.

For the past week, Nick has had extreme migraines & dizziness so Nick scheduled a doctors appt. Nick spent the night at Nick's grandma’s because the appt was much closer & Nick figured it would be easier to wake up there since Nick had been feeling bad & would have to drive less in the morning.

Coincidentally, his mom & Nick's grandma live in the same complex. After he got off of work, his plan was to go to his moms to sleep. They also agreed the night before that he would watch the baby while Nick went to Nick's appt.

He gets out of work at 6 AM. Nick woke up at 10 AM, appt was at 11:30 AM. It took Nick a while to get out of bed because of the migraines & dizziness, & Nick also got up several times in the night to feed/change the baby. Nick figured by that time he was already asleep but Nick would call him to wake him up to let him know Nick was going to be leaving for Nick's appt soon.

Remember that his mom & Nick's grandma live in the same complex, meaning it would have taken him less than 2 minutes to stop by & pick up the baby. Nick asked if he could do this because Nick was very dizzy, Nick still had to eat, get Nick ready, & get the baby ready. Nick would’ve been able to save a little bit of time & effort if he would have just stopped by to pick up the baby. If Nick had to drop the baby off, Nick would’ve spent more time also because his mom talks Nick's ear off even if Nick says Nick is in a rush.

He said he was not going to come pick her up because he was “trying to sleep” that he would send his mother instead. His mother has spinal issues and cannot walk down the stairs, especially not with a heavy car seat and diaper bag. Aside from that, Nick would’ve had to remove the car base from Nick's car & install it in his mother's, which was going to take Nick even more time & was going to be hard for Nick to do with Nick's symptoms.

Nick gets he works over night, & he was “trying to sleep” but he had been home for the past 4 hrs but when Nick asked for a favor that Nick never asks for, he’s trying to sleep. They ended up getting into a bad argument & said some ugly things to each other.

Is Nick the asshole for telling him off? Nick has built up over time which Nick has previously communicated to him but he brushes all of it off.

TL;DR: Nick has an appt because Nick's been suffering from extreme migraines the past week and Nick's boyfriend refused to drive 2 minutes to pick her up so Nick could go to Nick's drs appt.

AITA for using his wheelchair despite his parents' telling him not to? | Nick is 21 and Nick is starting uni. Nick has moved back in with his parents. Nick uses a chair in public. Nick does have the ability to walk, and tends to walk around the house because it is carpeted and has stairs (it's a struggle for Nick).  

What happened with his legs- Nick is weak. Nick's legs collapse frequently and even if they don't, Nick is in constant pain 24/7 if he walks. To the point of crying. Nick has been to his GP and has been instructed to STAY IN THE CHAIR, until they figure out what the fuck is up with him. Nick is not stated as disabled on any of his docs because he has no diagnosis yet, but has docs from his GP for chair use.  

Now the real meat of this is his parents. When they (S/O and Nick) were moving back in with them, they said to take one of the wheelchairs in the airport to skip ahead of the line. Nick then had to drop the bombshell that he actually has his own chair and has to use it because his legs are crap. Nick's parents did not like this.  

Some info, they see him as an abusive person because he refused to bend over and let them continously treat him like shit (making decisions for him, cutting him off from his family). Saying that he took advantage of them. Anyway, since he has moved back in, they are insistent about him not using his chair. On outings with them and his siblings, they'd force him to walk to look 'normal' and would make comments like "see? you're fine!" When then ten minutes later he has to sit down over and over and then pop a few painkillers to just not cry. He has tried to stand his ground but they refuse to listen.  

Last night, Nick was talking about his classmates to them, he was attending everyday, using public transport to get to his campus. His mom then asks him to never use his chair again, saying he shouldn't take advantage of people and he should stop pretending and just be "normal". His dad goes into this rant about how he just wants to take advantage of people's kindness, stating he is a cruel person for using the chair. Nick tried telling his dad that being disabled is difficult and he then said "then stop pretending and just work through it!" Nick insisted that it's too painful to ever do that and he has to listen to his doctor until they figure out what's up. He went on about how karma will bite him in the ass and that he will be unloved, jobless in the world cause of the chair. He then instructed him to ditch the chair in the next week, and to lie to all his mates that he is on medication and can walk. Nick refused. Until he stayed up at night thinking about it and letting it get to him, because he CAN walk and people do help him.  

What if they're right? Should he suck it up and just pop 4K mg a day and limp until his muscles get better? His S/O stands by the fact he needs his chair and will stand up for him the next time but he doesn't know if he wants them to do that? He is honestly just scared that he is this abusive fake that his parents say he is and he is just denying it. So AITA for still using his wheelchair despite his parents' telling him not to?

The puppy is a nightmare, and she doesn't discipline it or even take care of it). Since she was not getting attention from her mom she got her puppy and started saying "Look at the baby. Who's a good baby?" To the dog and brought him over to Nick's son. The puppy is feisty and squirmed almost scratching Nick's son in his grandmothers arms. Nick got mad and took Nick's son into Nick's GF's room (they've been staying with her mom since they live far away). When Nick walked out of the room she called Nick's son a dumb baby and said he was ugly. She came into the room later and told Nick to give her the baby, Nick told her no. Nick's GF agreed Nick did the right thing, but her sister decided Nick hates her and is taking it out on her mom. She screams at her mom constantly about nothing and told her mom that no one can drive her mom's car (they have been borrowing it while they are here to get around) not even her mom can drive it only her and she will drop her mom at work and keep the keys during the day.

Her brother was playing with her dog, which she didnt like, he was rubbing its belly while she screamed "STOP RAPPING MY DOG!!! IM CALLING THE POLICE IF YOU DON'T STOP NOW!!! WHY DONT YOU GO AND TOUCH (GF'S NAME)'S SON'S DICK INSTEAD!!!". Nick's GF had to stop Nick because Nick was livid. Nick decided then that she would not see his son until she got right. 

Last night they were at their friends house, they are a few days from flying back home. She texts Nick's GF angry because her brother told her Nick doesnt like her. WIBTA if Nick quit her hospitality job the week before Christmas? | This is Nick's first ever post so she is sorry if Nick has got anything wrong!

Nick has been working as a restaurant manager for over 10 years but in September this year started at a new place as a deputy manager to take a step back from the stress of being the general manager. Nick's last general manager job caused her to end up in a deep depression & so Nick thought Nick would be better off as a deputy.

Turns out Nick was wrong. Nick's job started off great with a promise of having at least 2 evenings a week free, one night so Nick could play Nick's sport (which helps keep Nick's mental health in check) & Nick helped the GM with all the rotas & was given lots of praise for the job Nick has been doing. Recently Nick hasn't been getting any evenings off in the week, Nick's shift patterns are usually 3-close, 12-10 or 12-close, meaning Nick is only free to do anything else on Nick's days off (i.e. see friends, see Nick's boyfriend, see Nick's family, Christmas shopping, tidy the house etc) & worst of all Nick has been put to work on the days Nick plays Nick's sport, Nick's team aren’t particularly happy with her!

On top of that Nick's general manager is an AH. He never says hello as Nick comes in, he never thanks anyone for their hard work even though all their reviews have been amazing, he constantly is moaning or telling people off for things that most of the time aren’t even wrong, they’re just not his way (his way changes every week Nick will never get it right) & people are now fearful of coming to work as they know they will be shouted at as soon as they walk through the door.

Only recently has Nick managed to end up in his bad books (reasons unknown Nick has been doing Nick's job the same way since the start). He has undermined Nick on the rotas, twice now after Nick spent hours of Nick's time doing them he has then scribbled them out in front of Nick's face & said Nick has been too nice to staff so he will re-do them. Nick accepted Nick would be working all over Christmas because Nick knows the industry but asked if Nick could maybe not do the whole day Christmas Eve or start a little later on Christmas Day to spend a small amount of time with Nick's family, instead he actually extended Nick's shifts from what Nick had suggested they could be. He also extended some of Nick's other shifts that week meaning Nick was working all day on Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, Boxing Day & the 2 days after that as well, no time to see Nick's family or Nick's heavily pregnant sister who would be visiting.

Nick could go on forever about the things he has done to Nick lately but long story short, Nick is now having daily panic attacks about going to work & has had to return to Nick's GP for help with Nick's depression. Both the GP & Nick's parents think the job is not worth Nick's happiness but Nick knows the staff (who Nick thinks are all great btw it’s just the manager who isn’t) will be short over Christmas without Nick & the GM may have to cancel his holiday he has booked from Boxing Day.

So WIBTA if Nick told them this week Nick won’t be coming back (& not even serving Nick's notice)?

AITA? Nick told her parents they couldn't see her son unless it was separately. | Nick's parents had been unhappily married for 33 years, ever since they were 16. It was a shotgun wedding on account of Nick's older sister. When Nick was a kid they'd argue constantly and dad pretty much would live with them for a year, move out for a year, move back in for a year, move back out for a year, and every time they'd say it was over, they were getting divorced, they couldn't make it work, and then dad would move back in and things would resume. They'd also try and bring Nick and her sister into arguments and get them to say whose side they were on. Nick moved out as soon as she reached 18 because she was just so tired of hearing them fight all the time. They made it clear they were only together for Nick and her sister, and Nick and her sister told them at one point that they could split up with no hard feelings from them, but they didn't believe them and thought they were "putting on a brave face" for their sake so they stayed together. They refused to see a marriage counselor or any sort of therapist, separate or together, as they felt it was a waste of time, money, and energy.

Nick's son was 7 years old. Nick lived within 90 minutes of her parents' house, and after her son's father left they offered to help her out with childcare. Nick refused initially as he was in preschool so he had someone to go to, but when the school holidays rolled around Nick had to ask them for some help. One of the first times he was with them for the day (he was 3 or 4 at this point) he came home and told Nick they'd spent the day fighting, tried to make him pick a side, and he didn't want to go back. Nick told both of them that spending the day yelling at each other in front of him and dragging him into their fight was unacceptable. They tried to pull Nick's sister into the argument and she offered to watch Nick's son rather than send him back there.

On Saturday around 10 Nick got a call asking her to come into work for a meeting at 12. Nick asked her sister if she could watch her son but it was too short notice. Nick called her parents and asked if they could meet her at Nick's town center, and just watch him for a couple hours and take him to the beach or round the shops. They agreed. Nick was gone for approx 1hr30 and in that time they had an argument. Nick's son said there was no yelling but they'd tried to make him pick sides again.

Nick gave it a lot of thought and rang them today and told them that they could only see her son from here on out if they were apart, and if they ever tried to pull him into an argument again they wouldn't be allowed to see either of them.

Nick felt justified because at the end of the day she was talking about Nick's relationship with her parents and her son, however in the conversation they did make some valid points, including that Nick's son loved them and wanted to see them, they'd been together 3 decades, and Nick's dad had a sight issue that meant it wasn't safe for him to drive after dark so he couldn't come alone until summer.

AITA?

AITA If Nick Chooses A Random Couple For Adoption Than Stepsister? | 
So Nick (21F) is in her junior year of college. Nick’s been extremely careful on not getting pregnant and has tried all avanues. Her IUD moved and she almost died so she had to get it removed, the implant in her arm left a rash and started to burn so she had it removed, so Nick and her FWB started using the calendar and condom method which is basically when she isn’t ovulating they would use the pull out method and when she was they would use a condom and a Plan B just for backup.

Well, Nick’s pregnant. She found out in the beginning of December that she is four weeks along. She knew immediately she didn’t want to keep the baby. Nick considered going through with an abortion via the pill. She got them but couldn’t do it. Nick knows that it was selfish, but until you’re in those shoes you never know how it truly feels.

So Nick decided adoption. She told her friend that she was planning on delivering the baby and she told Nick about her brother and her sister in law back in her home state that have been struggling with infertility and have been desperately trying to conceive a baby for years without fail. They FaceTimed a few times and Nick thinks they would be perfect parents for her baby. They’re both well educated with well paying jobs and an amazing home they could raise a baby in. It actually made Nick excited to be able to know that the baby will go to a family that so desperately wants them. Nick decided they would be a great fit and since they’re so far away, it’s like it never happened kinda thing.

Nick finally brought it up to her mom yesterday that she’s pregnant and everything else. Her mom’s first words were “What about Sylvia? Her and Jon would love a baby”. Nick’s older stepsister is 28 and infertile. She’s known this for years and they aren’t that close so Nick didn’t know if she ever planned on having a baby through other means.

Nick said no. Sylvia lives in the same city as Nick and Nick sees her during holidays and any other family gatherings. Nick doesn’t want to adopt the baby into her own family circle and still have to be in some form of its life. She would basically become the step aunt? Nick just prefers the idea of having a closed adoption in a far away state with a picture every once in a while. Her mom started gushing and called Sylvia immediately despite Nick’s protests who seemed really happy. She told Nick’s mom they were looking into an egg donor and a surrogate but this baby is so much less expensive and less of a hassle.

Nick told Sylvia that she doesn’t want to give the baby to her for the reasons she listed above and kind of already “promised” another couple that they could adopt the baby. Now Nick hasn’t gone through any legal channels via the other couple so it’s not like she HAS to do it, but she really wants to. Sylvia got upset and asked why Nick would choose a random couple that she knows nothing about versus her own “flesh and blood” (Their parents have only been married for 3 years and they never lived under the same roof as she was 25 then). She and Nick’s mom both called Nick an asshole.

AITA for hoping siblings will help care for Nick's dying mom | This is a throwaway account.

Nick's mom is 80 and Nick has been caring for her mom for 20 yrs. Nick's mom does not get enough social security to afford living on her own and Nick made the decision to be with her mom. Nick accepts responsibility for that. Nick's mom has begged Nick not to put her mom in a facility and Nick has honored that.

Nick is the youngest of 5 and Nick's siblings are a lot older than Nick. There is a lot of history here, but Nick has to keep it short. Nick will gladly answer any requests for more info.

3 of Nick's siblings do very well financially and the other one gets by OK. 2 of them live close by and the other 2 live in another state. None of them have helped out with Nick's mom over the years and Nick accepted that. Nick has been a single mom for 24 yrs and things have been tough at times.

Nick's mom has been very ill in the past. Nick has worked 2 jobs and Nick's adult son moved back home to help. Nick's siblings who live close by did not help with getting Nick's mom to dr appts, caring for her mom at home, or any financials. Despite this, they want to remain in contact, be kept informed of Nick's mom's status, and have a say in Nick's mom's affairs.

Nick's son, who was working and going to college full time, quit school to help. Nick did not ask him to do this and it kills Nick that he did. When Nick's mom got better, Nick's son landed a better job, saved up money, and prepared to move out again.

Nick's mom then became severely ill with diabetes and was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer. Nick's son stayed home, Nick left Nick's job and withdrew Nick's retirement money so Nick could stay home to provide the 24 hr care Nick's mom needs. Nick's retirement money has since run out and now the burden is falling completely on Nick's son.

Nick's siblings think Nick should be home caring for their mom and they said they would help, but since having this discussion they claim they do not have extra money or time. Nick’s been happy that they are successful and can afford many luxuries. Nick told them that Nick doesn't think anyone is obligated to provide assistance, but Nick would like for them to make their intentions clear so there are no false expectations or angry reactions to decisions Nick may have to make (e.g. one of Nick's siblings was unhappy with potential funeral plans due to Nick's financial constraints). Nick has to get a job and cannot leave Nick's mom alone. Nick's mom probably does not have long to live so they’re not talking about a situation that will drag on for years. Nick can try to work overnights while Nick's son is home, but Nick doesn't know when Nick will get any sleep due to so many dr appts. Nick's siblings have the resources to help, but they are not doing so. Yet they cry on the phone when discussing Nick's mom's impending death.

AITA for Nick thinking her siblings should sacrifice a few luxuries in order to help keep their mom happy in her final days and/or the ones who live close by at least help with getting her mom to appts and taking turns caring for her mom while Nick works since they claim to care and want to be involved in decision making?

AITA For Cutting Nick’s “Tough Love” Mom Out Of Nick’s Life? | Nick is a 43F single mom of a 13M. Nick has been diagnosed with depression and anxiety for the past 12 years. About two months ago, Nick was having a terrible period in her life, and made some changes all at once. Nick quit her job, moved back to her hometown, ended her relationship, and went off all her meds. It was a very hard couple of months for both Nick and her son. They are both starting to feel better and things are getting back to a good place. Nick is on different meds and has started a new job. Nick's son is doing pretty good at school and is happy to be back in Nick's hometown.

The issue is that Nick's ex-fiancé got ahold of Nick's mother when they first moved out to let Nick's mother know what was happening and that Nick was not in a good place. Nick's son also reached out to Nick's mother when he was feeling particularly down and wanted someone to talk to. Nick's mother basically blew Nick's son off and never bothered to check back on Nick's son again. Nick's mother never contacted Nick to check in either.
